content: length of plate colored yarn thread the yarn through an extra long needle insert the needle at the junction of two plates and the underbody bring the needle through the same junction on the opposite side of the underbody and pull approximately half of the yarn length through switch to a darning needle insert the needle at the junction where two plate ridges overlap and bring it out under the ridge of the foremost plate repeat for the other end of the yarn on the opposite side of the body the yarn should lie where the two plates overlap and just behind the foremost plates cross the two ends of the yarn together and pull this will cause the plate/underbody to cinch up and add more definition to the overlap between the two plates do *not* knot the two ends of the yarn yet repeat for the intersections between each 6 plate once each plate intersection has been evenly cinched triple knot each yarn end together to secure 26 27 28 pin mask between r1 and r14 of underbody centering it with the ridge-line of the plates sew into place using seamless 7 stitches pin large eyes between r3 and r11 of mask there should be 5 to 6 stitches between the eyes in r3 and 15 to 16 8 stitches in r11 sew into place using seamless stitches 29 9 pin small eyes r11 and r12 with 9 to 10 stitches in between the eyes sew into place using seamless stitches 10 hide all yarn ends inside work 30 finished examples 31 32 33
